name: intercorrelate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If facts, numbers, etc. intercorrelate or are intercorrelated, they are closely related to one another: be highly intercorrelated The variables were highly intercorrelated. In most studies, the scales for mother and child inter-correlate.
More examplesFewer examplesThese patterns of behaviour might all be intercorrelated.Assessments of the full range of mental activities at each stage of life were only moderately intercorrelated. As expected from previous research, the two scoring methods were significantly intercorrelated.
